case_vignette:
A 6-year-old girl presents with a 1-year history of a waxing and waning rash on her limbs and face. The rash starts as red scaly bumps that fade over several weeks leaving smooth white spots. Every few months, the patient gets several new red bumps. The rash is not itchy or painful. Her parents have tried topical steroid creams that did not help clear the rash. Examination reveals scattered erythematous scaly papules on both legs and several hypopigmented macules on her legs, arms, and face. The patient's mother reports that the patient has had several episodes of fever and joint pain in the past year. The patient's mother also reports that the patient has had several episodes of fever and joint pain in the past year. The patient's mother is concerned that the patient may have a condition that is causing her symptoms.

Examination reveals scattered erythematous scaly papules on both legs and several hypopigmented macules on their legs, arms, and face. The patient's parents report that the patient has had several episodes of fever and joint pain in the past year. The patient's parents are concerned that the patient may have a condition that is causing their symptoms.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a recurring rash on my limbs and face, and I've also experienced several episodes of fever and joint pain over the past year.
Have you noticed any triggers that might be causing the rash, such as sun exposure, certain foods, or stress?
No, I haven't noticed any specific triggers for the rash.
Do you have any other healthcare conditions, such as autoimmune diseases, or is there a family history of similar symptoms?
I don't have any other known healthcare conditions, and there's no mention of a family history of similar symptoms.
Have any skin biopsies or blood tests been done regarding your symptoms? If yes, what were the results?
No skin biopsies or blood tests have been mentioned regarding my symptoms.
Have your symptoms been persistent or do they tend to recede and flare up periodically?
My symptoms tend to recede and flare up periodically.
Final Diagnosis: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)
